trans-unit.source: Debugging Azure Cloud Services | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Debugging Azure Cloud Services | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: You can use different approaches to debug an Azure application by using the Azure Tools for Microsoft Visual Studio and the Azure SDK:
trans-unit.target: You can use different approaches to debug an Azure application by using the Azure Tools for Microsoft Visual Studio and the Azure SDK:

trans-unit.source: You can debug an Azure application from Visual Studio when you are developing it, just as you would any Visual C# or Visual Basic application.
trans-unit.target: You can debug an Azure application from Visual Studio when you are developing it, just as you would any Visual C# or Visual Basic application.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Debugging a cloud service or virtual machine in Visual Studio](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=623018).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Debugging a cloud service or virtual machine in Visual Studio](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=623018).

trans-unit.source: You can use Azure Diagnostics to log detailed information from code running within roles, whether the roles are running in the development environment or in Azure.
trans-unit.target: You can use Azure Diagnostics to log detailed information from code running within roles, whether the roles are running in the development environment or in Azure.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Collecting logging data by using Azure Diagnostics](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=400450).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Collecting logging data by using Azure Diagnostics](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=400450).

trans-unit.source: If you are using Visual Studio Enterprise to write roles targeted at the .NET Framework 4 or the .NET Framework 4.5, you can enable IntelliTrace at the time that you deploy an Azure cloud service from Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Visual Studio Enterprise to write roles targeted at the .NET Framework 4 or the .NET Framework 4.5, you can enable IntelliTrace at the time that you deploy an Azure cloud service from Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: IntelliTrace provides a log that you can use with Visual Studio to debug your application as if it were running in Azure.
trans-unit.target: IntelliTrace provides a log that you can use with Visual Studio to debug your application as if it were running in Azure.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Debugging a published cloud service with IntelliTrace and Visual Studio]( http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=623016).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Debugging a published cloud service with IntelliTrace and Visual Studio]( http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=623016).

trans-unit.source: You can enable remote debugging on your cloud services at the time when you deploy the cloud service from Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: You can enable remote debugging on your cloud services at the time when you deploy the cloud service from Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: If you choose to enable remote debugging for a deployment, remote debugging services are installed on the virtual machines that run each role instance.
trans-unit.target: If you choose to enable remote debugging for a deployment, remote debugging services are installed on the virtual machines that run each role instance.

trans-unit.source: These services, such as msvsmon.exe, do not affect performance or result in extra costs.
trans-unit.target: These services, such as msvsmon.exe, do not affect performance or result in extra costs.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Debugging a cloud service or virtual machine in Visual Studio](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=623018).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Debugging a cloud service or virtual machine in Visual Studio](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=623018).
